alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 02 at 8:12PM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 20.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
